sentence.Network_en: This rule is set forth in the rescript of the Emperor Antoninus.
sentence.Network_cn: 这项规定是在安东尼皇帝颁布的法令中提出的。

sentence.Network_en: Puyi , who is just like an outcast, read out the abdicate rescript.
sentence.Network_cn: 如同丧家之犬的溥仪也随之神情沮丧地宣读了退位主诏书.

sentence.Network_en: Rescript, after been write, save, come out to hint again mistake, say to be lost again.
sentence.Network_cn: 重写, 写好后保存, 又出来提示错误, 称再次丢失.

list.abs: and this rule is set forth in a rescript of the Emperor Antoninus ., 这是由安东尼皇帝的批复所规定的.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (denoting a papal decision): from Latin rescriptum, neuter past participle of rescribere 'write back', from re- 'back' + scribere 'write'

means.word_mean: 1. a reply by a Pope to an inquiry concerning a point of law or morality
2. a legally binding command or decision entered on the court record (as if issued by a court or judge);

sentences.sentence: "a friend in New Mexico said that the order caused no trouble out there"

means.word_mean: 4. something that has been written again;
